channel.title: Posts on math2001's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on math2001's blog

item.title: Go Order of Operation Matters
item.description: In Go, two mathematically equivalent expression can yield different result based on the order in which you do things! Thanks rounding errors…

item.title: Motion and calculus
item.description: If you studied physics, one of the first things you probably did was graph the “motion” of objects. That is the displacement, velocity, and acceleration at an instant t. Didn't it remind you of a mathematical concept?

item.title: How to combine svgs
item.description: If you want your website to be fast, you should limit the number of http requests. A great way of doing that is combining your images. If you use SVGS for your icons and stuff like that, here's how you can combine all your icon in one big file, and use them in your website!
